title: If we as humans never invented clothing, would we have eventually evolved to have fur? - Quora

response.answer_text: I HOPE not.  (Photo by Carollyne Yardley) How would YouTube makeup tutorials work with this? Yeah; what foundation or concealer would cover all of that there? Atleast acne and wrinkles wouldn’t be visible! Botox, fillers, rhinoplasty and facelifts wouldn’t be necessary. Shedding all the time and bathing yourself like a cat licks its fur to bathe…. wouldn’t be too attractive. Fur all over the couch, dinner table and bed sheets! Who needs that! If we had tails, we’d be chasing our own tail when bored or during a nervous breakdown of sorts. Mating would be a disaster. Fleas would be considered an STD in one way or another. Contraction of fleas from sex. Seriously, literally NO ONE needs this! There’s a saying that goes “you lay down with a dog; you get flees” (about cheating) and that would be even more applicable if we had fur! Shaving and remove female body hair is exhausting enough as it is. I don’t think people who love tattoos would want to be covered in fur either. I don’t think we’d evolve to have any more body hair than other primates do; although in contrast, their head hair does grow to the extent of what humans does. VERY good question by the way!

No, because we would simply have kept the HAIR we always had to start with, since humans with hairy bodies would out-compete the less hairy kinds for reproductive success. It’s the opposite - we used to have hairy bodies, and have evolved toward generally losing it. It is not impossible to imagine that humans as a group might eventually regain that thick hair - most people still have all the hair follicles, we just don’t grow long thick hairs from them (now), but we COULD. But we are highly unlikely to switch to fur.
